intro: Diplotaxis gorgadensis, commonly known as the African ironweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, and it produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. Diplotaxis gorgadensis is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
